metadata.title: CVE-2020-15366 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ajv.validate() in Ajv (aka Another JSON SchemaValidator) 6.12.2. A carefully crafted JSON schema could be provided thatallows execution of other code by prototype pollution. (While untrustedschemas are recommended against, the worst case of an untrusted schemashould be a denial of service, not execution of code.)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-ajv - 6.12.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-ajv package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.12.4-1').
